title: Quake measures 3.6 in whatcom county
author: Ap
text: DEMING, Whatcom County - An earthquake measuring 3.6 on the Richter scale rattled several Whatcom County towns last night, but no damage was reported, authorities said.        The quake, which struck at 9:49 p.m., was centered about a mile southeast of Deming, which is about 15 miles northeast of Bellingham, said Chris Jonientz-Trisler of the University of Washington seismology lab in Seattle.        Residents of Everson, Deming and Nugents Corner reported feeling the temblor, she said.        It was one of 60 to 80 relatively minor quakes felt in northwest Washington this year, she added. ``There's no indication that anything larger is imminent.''        An earthquake of 3.5 on the Richter scale can cause slight damage in a local area. Each number on the scale represents a tenfold increase in magnitude.
